tool.name: SAGA.pointcloud_tools.12
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayPC_LAYERS True output_data_PC_OUT $output_data_PC_OUT name SAGA.pointcloud_tools.12 PC_LAYERS $PC_LAYERS DEL_LAYERS $DEL_LAYERS ADD_IDENTIFIER $ADD_IDENTIFIER START_VALUE $START_VALUE prefer $prefer response $response outputType_PC_OUT $OutputSection_PC_OUT.outputType_PC_OUT transmissionMode_PC_OUT $OutputSection_PC_OUT.transmissionMode_PC_OUT

param.name: PC_LAYERS
param.label: Point Clouds
param.help: Point Clouds The following data types are allowed in the txt file: x-ogc-lasf

param.name: DEL_LAYERS
param.label: Delete Input
param.help: Removes input layers from memory while merging.

param.name: ADD_IDENTIFIER
param.label: Add Input Identifier
param.help: Adds a field with an identifier for the input point cloud a point originates from.

param.name: START_VALUE
param.label: Start Value
param.help: The start value to be used for the identifier.

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_PC_OUT
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

param.name: outputType_PC_OUT
param.label: Author did not provide help for this parameter...

tool.help: This tool can be used to merge point clouds. The attribute fields of the merged point cloud resemble those of the first point cloud in the input list. In order to merge the attributes of the additional point cloud layers, these must be consistent (field name and type) with the first point cloud in the input list. Missing attribute values are set to no-data.
